ticket.title: RFC-0032: Kernel-Native FAC vNext cutover (epic tracker)

tickets.reason: Core-ledger migration must land first (Phase 0 prerequisite)
System acceptance tests must be green before promotion

in_scope: Track RFC-0032 implementation phases (0-6) as discrete mergeable tickets
Maintain cross-ticket invariants: ledger+CAS reconstructibility, bounded decoding, topic derivation tests, parity gates fail-closed
Maintain the shared FAC security contract (`documents/work/tickets/FAC_SECURITY_MODEL_INVARIANTS_V1.yaml`) and keep open child tickets mapped to it
Ensure acceptance tests AT-0..AT-5 exist and are promotion-blocking in production mode
Coordinate deprecation/removal sequencing for WorkRegistry authority and legacy ledger writers
out_of_scope: Implement code changes directly (handled by dependent tickets)
Redesign actor identity / cryptographic model beyond vNext (explicitly deferred by RFC-0032)

steps: Keep dependency graph current; update this ticket when child tickets are added/merged
Maintain a 'Phase checklist' section in RFC-0032 tracking migration readiness signals (metrics/tests/gates)
Run AT-0..AT-5 on every promotion candidate; treat failures as promotion-blocking

criteria: All Phase 0-6 tickets required for vNext are MERGED.
All drift-control guardrails are implemented with tests (schema registry allowlist, topic derivation coverage, parity gates).
Every open RFC-0032/FAC child ticket includes an explicit `fac_security_contract` mapping to shared invariants.
AT-0..AT-5 pass in CI and can be executed locally against a seeded legacy DB.
No daemon codepath can append to legacy `ledger_events` in production mode.

notes.security: Fail-closed by default; do not weaken existing promotion-blocking gates (alias reconciliation, parity/merge gates).
notes.verification: Track and publish a reproducible end-to-end demo script exercising AT-0..AT-5.

enforcement_requirements: Any new requirement, code path, or test added under this ticket must map to one or more required_invariants.
Any invariant relaxation requires explicit amendment in this ticket and the shared security model document.
Reviewer denial is expected for invariant-unmapped behavior changes.
